short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Adds a button to GitHub Pull Request pages to create a Release from the current Pull Request

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
If you or your company follows this workflow:

- developers work on a feature branch
- feature branches are deployed to staging / prod & smoke-tested / validated there
- validated, deployed feature branches are released & merged back into master

Then this extension might help you. It adds a "Create Release" button near the "Merge" button on a Pull Request which will open a new release with data from the current PR (branch as target, title, summary, incremented tag). You can edit, or simply create the release from here. It's just a little time-saver (:
